Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பரியினும் ஆகாவாம் பாலல்ல உய்த்துச் சொரியினும் போகா தம.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Things not your own will yield no good, howe'er you guard with pain; Your own, howe'er you scatter them abroad, will yours remain.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition. Left: A person desperately tries to hold onto water (representing what is not fated) in their cupped hands, but it streams out uselessly despite their efforts.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Right: The same person casually tosses a handful of glowing seeds (representing what is fated) into the wind, but the seeds defy the wind and spiral back, planting themselves at the person's feet.
Layered_Composition.Background: A vast, open plain under a neutral sky, emphasizing that this principle of fate applies universally.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A visual metaphor for the principle of fate: what is not meant to be yours cannot be retained, and what is destined to be yours cannot be lost.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The escaping water symbolizes what is not destined ('பாலல்ல'). The returning, glowing seeds represent what is destined ('தம').
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Natural, realistic lighting. The water on the left is plain and transparent. The seeds on the right have a magical, golden glow to signify their destined nature.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Wide shot showcasing both actions in a balanced manner.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with high-speed photography effects to capture the water and seed movements.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Clear, even lighting to focus on the symbolic actions.

Cultural_Anchors: What is destined vs. not destined ('பாலல்ல', 'தம')
The futility of fighting one's ordained fate.

Negative_Prompt: person holding the water successfully, seeds blowing away, text, cartoonish, distracting background elements.
